title: Creature Feature Quiz: 1950s Edition
hint1: Don't let the cheesy effects fool you!
hint2: Some of these monsters are more famous than others...
introText:
WELCOME TO THE CREATURE FEATURE QUIZ: 1950s EDITION!

GRAB YOUR POPCORN AND HIDE BEHIND THE COUCH AS WE EXPLORE THE DELIGHTFULLY CHEESY WORLD OF 1950s HORROR.

questions.question: What color was the original 'Blob' in the 1958 classic?
Which future 'Star Trek' star faced off against the titular creature in 'Them!' (1954)?
How tall was the creature in 'Attack of the 50 Foot Woman' (1958)?
What household item could supposedly kill the aliens in 'War of the Worlds' (1953)?
What animal was enlarged to create the monsters in 'Them!'?
Which 1950s horror film featured a creature made partly from tobacco plants?
incorrect: The Monster That Challenged the World

questions.question: Put these 1950s horror films in order of release, earliest first:
What was the occupation of the main character in 'The Fly' (1958)?
What famous horror actor played Baron Victor von Frankenstein in 'The Curse of Frankenstein' (1957)?
In 'Plan 9 from Outer Space' (1959), what were the aliens trying to prevent humans from creating?
How many eyes did the mutant have in 'The Crawling Eye' (1958)?
What unique feature did the monster in 'The Monolith Monsters' (1957) have?
What famous makeup artist created the Creature from the Black Lagoon's iconic look?
In 'Tarantula' (1955), what substance caused the spider's gigantic growth?
Order these Hammer Horror films by release date, earliest first:
What was unique about the filming of 'House of Wax' (1953)?
questions.correct: It was the first color 3-D film from a major studio
incorrect: It was filmed in complete darkness

questions.question: What legendary B-movie director made 'Robot Monster' (1953)?
In 'The Beast from 20,000 Fathoms' (1953), what awakened the prehistoric monster?
How many different monsters appeared in 'Monster on the Campus' (1958)?
What was the budget of 'Plan 9 from Outer Space' (1959)?
